'''House Harlaw''' is a vassal house that holds fealty to [[House Greyjoy]] of [[Pyke (castle)|Pyke]]. Their seat is [[Ten Towers]] located on [[Harlaw]], the easternmost of the [[Iron Islands]].
sections.In the books:
In the ''[[A Song of Ice and Fire]]'' novels, House Harlaw is a powerful family with strong ties to the Greyjoys. They have several branches along the island of Harlaw as well as several vassals. The sigil of House Harlaw is a silver scythe on black. The current head of the family is Lord Rodrik Harlaw, brother of Lady [[Alannys Harlaw]], called Rodrik the Reader for his passion for books (a habit that other ironmen find strange and unmanly).

As one of the wealthiest and most powerful families in the Iron Islands, House Harlaw has multiple [[Cadet branch|cadet branches]]:

* House Harlaw of Harlaw Hall
* House Harlaw of Grey Garden
* House Harlaw of Tower of Glimmering
* House Harlaw of Harridan Hill
sections.Members: *[[Alannys Greyjoy|Alannys Harlaw]], the wife of [[Balon Greyjoy]] and mother of [[Rodrik Greyjoy|Rodrik]], [[Maron Greyjoy|Maron]], [[Yara Greyjoy|Yara]], and [[Theon Greyjoy]]<ref>[http://viewers-guide.hbo.com/game-of-thrones/#!/guide/houses/greyjoy/ HBO viewers guide, season 2 guide to houses, House Greyjoy entry]</ref>
